title: [Large-Scale] Blended Learning-Based Mobile Microlearning Course for Strengthening Pharmaceutical Practice Competencies: Utilizing Medical Communication and Professional Terminology

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory pharmaceutical theory, understanding of work experience requirements, and familiarity with basic medical terminology
context.additional_context: Comprising working professionals, learners must focus on immediately applicable, practice-oriented content (e.g., patient consultation simulations, diagnostic report writing) in BYOD environments. Linked with offline practical sessions, the course emphasizes improving communication skills in real healthcare settings.

learning_goals: Through pharmaceutical simulation modules, learners can analyze five or more work-related cases (e.g., patient counseling, diagnostic report writing) and propose solutions utilizing professional terminology

Learners can participate in real-time discussion and feedback sessions at least three times per week via mobile platforms, sharing practical application strategies based on medical terminology and precise expressions
Based on medical communication competencies and professional terminology skills acquired in blended learning environments, learners can achieve a 20% improvement in workplace efficiency
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
